citations.quote: Although consensus motifs for MYB transcription factors occur in most gene promoters of the whole phenylpropanoid pathway, functional evidence for their contribution to promoter activity has only been demonstrated for a few of them.

items.target_gene: upstream genes in the lignin biosynthetic pathway
items.notes: Overexpression activates upstream lignin biosynthetic genes and causes ectopic lignin deposition

citations.quote: Overexpression of PtoMYB216 specifically activated the expression of the upstream genes in the lignin biosynthetic pathway and resulted in ectopic deposition of lignin...
The results suggest that PtoMYB216 is specific transcriptional activators of lignin biosynthesis...

citations.quote: The study focuses on the transcriptional regulation of lignin biosynthesis by PtoMYB216, a R2R3-MYB transcription factor, through activation of upstream genes in the lignin pathway.

items.limitation_or_gap: Most wood-associated transcription factors have not been functionally characterized due to the difficulty of genetic studies in tree species.
items.scope: lignin biosynthesis and secondary wall formation
items.notes: Mentioned in the context of challenges in studying tree species.

items.limitation_or_gap: Uncertainty about whether PtoMYB216 and related transcription factors regulate biosynthesis of other secondary wall components (e.g., cellulose, xylan) during wood formation.
items.notes: Explicitly stated as an unresolved question in the text.

citations.quote: it is not clear whether these wood-associated transcription factors also regulate the biosynthesis of other secondary wall components during wood formation
